Please note that your query can be better answered using our "Custom Reports" feature which can be found on the left side panel. You can build your own report such as newsletters, market letters, investment memos, management Q&A, DDQs and more.Based on today's investment bank research activity, the most significant updates include multiple upgrades across healthcare, technology, and energy sectors, alongside several new coverage initiations. UBS led upgrade activity with CVS Health receiving a double upgrade, while Wells Fargo initiated multiple new coverage positions.

          New Coverage Initiations
        
Multiple banks initiated coverage positions today, with technology and data analytics companies receiving particular attention. Wells Fargo initiated coverage of NIQ with an Overweight rating and $21 price target, while BNP Paribas Exane assigned an Outperform rating with a $22.50 target 1012. Deutsche Bank began coverage of McGraw Hill with a Buy rating and $18 price target, and MoffettNathanson initiated Live Nation coverage with a Buy rating and $195 price target 10.Citi initiated coverage of Duolingo with a Buy rating and $400 price target, citing strong engagement profiles and 40% growth in daily active users 11. The firm also maintained multiple Buy ratings including Bank of America at $54, Roblox at $152, and FedEx at $275 despite lowering estimates due to macro headwinds 1113.

          Sector-Specific Themes
        
Morgan Stanley's price target adjustments in the P&C insurance sector reflected broader industry dynamics, lowering Brown & Brown to $105 from $109 and Irwin Financial to $305 from $315 while maintaining Equal Weight ratings 89. The firm cited increased competition in personal auto insurance and cautious optimism for commercial lines growth.International coverage expanded with Daiwa initiating Futu Holdings at Buy with a $190 price target, while BofA raised its target to $172 and Citi increased to $176 1. Canadian banking coverage saw multiple target increases, with Desjardins raising CIBC to C$106 and Jefferies increasing its target to $74.19 2.
